executiveSummary: Paige Bratton, a Hawaiian entrepreneur, pitched Seaworthy Eye Patches on Shark Tank, seeking $250,000 for 10% equity to help children with amblyopia. She highlighted her product's innovative, patented design and its success in generating $1.7 million in sales over four years. Although no Sharks invested, several encouraged her to continue independently and suggested potential licensing opportunities.
keyDecisions: No major investment decisions were made; Paige was advised to continue running her business independently and explore licensing opportunities.

actionItems.task: Explore licensing opportunities with interested Sharks
Continue direct sales and grow customer acquisition, particularly via pediatric ophthalmology channels

nextSteps: Paige will continue operating Seaworthy Eye Patches independently, leveraging her current sales channels and considering licensing deals suggested by Sharks.
